data.title: The Duncan Banner
data.meta_description: Michael Bell passed away. This is the full obituary where you can share condolences and memories. Published in the The Duncan Banner on 2011-05-23.
data.text: Dec. 20, 1980 — May 23, 2011 Michael Alan Bell, age 30 and owner of Rockin’ B Meat Co. in Comanche, passed away Monday, May 23, 2011 at Oklahoma Heart Hospital North in Oklahoma City. He was born Dec. 20, 1980 in Andrews, Texas to Alan and Teresa Bell and was raised in Plains, Texas. He graduated from Plains High School in 1999. After high school he moved to Tulsa, to attend the Spartan College of Aeronautics and Technology, and later worked as an instrumentation Journeyman in the natural gas industry. In Tulsa he met his wife, Valerie, and they married in Duncan on June 27, 2009. In January, 2011, Mike and Valerie accomplished their dream of starting a barbeque restaurant, and opened the doors to the Rockin’ B Meat Co. in Comanche. Mike was a man of many hobbies. He particularly enjoyed bullriding, golf, motocross and was a firearms enthusiast. Michael is survived by his wife Valerie; his parents: Alan and Teresa Bell of Plains, Texas; sister: Erica and her husband Kelly McDonald; two nieces: Jaycee Bell and Kelcee McDonald, of Wolfforth, Texas; grandparents: Helen and Charlie Pope of Plains, Texas, and Dan and Clara Bell of Idalou, Texas; and numerous aunts, uncles, cousins and close friends. He was preceded in death by grandparents Baz and Judy Laughlin in 1995. Michael was the son-in-law of Steve and Jera Alcorn, of Duncan, and Allen and Sue Wooten, of Comanche. A memorial service will take place at 11 a.m. on Wednesday May 25 at West Side Christian Church, 1801 W. Beech Ave. Duncan, with the Rev. Fred Rider officiating. Another memorial service will be held in Plains, Texas on Saturday May 28. In lieu of flowers, a memorial fund has been established in Michael’s name at the First National Bank of Comanche.
